Package ca.cgjennings.spelling.dict

Class Tools

java.lang.Object
ca.cgjennings.spelling.dict.Tools
public class Tools extends Object
This class groups together utility methods for creating and managing word list files.

  • Method Summary

    Method

  • Method Details

    • read

      public static WordList read​(File f) throws IOException
      Returns a word list by reading it from a file. The file format is inferred from the extension:
      .3tree
      a ternary tree list
      .cpl
      a CPL-compressed plain text list
      other
      an uncompressed list in UTF-8
      Parameters:
      f - the file to read the list from
      Returns:
      a concrete word list
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs

    • write

      public static void write​(File f, Set<String> words) throws IOException
      Converts a set of words into a WordList and then writes it to a file. The type of word list is chosen based on the file extension (see read(java.io.File)).
      Parameters:
      f - the file to write the list to
      words - the set of words to include
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs

    • listToSet

      public static Set<String> listToSet​(WordList wl)
      Creates a set containing all of the strings in a word list. The methods in Tools work with sets rather than lists, because lists do not generally support removing words.
      Parameters:
      wl - the word list to convert
      Returns:
      a set of the words in the list

    • listToArray

      public static String[] listToArray​(WordList wl)
      Creates an array containing all of the strings in a word list. The methods in Tools work with sets rather than lists, because lists do not generally support removing words.
      Parameters:
      wl - the word list to convert
      Returns:
      a set of the words in the list

    • setToArray

      public static String[] setToArray​(Set<String> wl)
      Creates an array consisting of the words in a set in sorted order. This is ideal for creating a WordList after performing set operations on a dictionary.
      Parameters:
      wl - the set to convert
      Returns:
      an array of the words in wl
      See Also:
      WordList.addAll(java.lang.String[])

    • union

      public static Set<String> union​(Set<String> list1, Set<String>... list2)
      Returns a new word set that merges the contents of two or more lists.
      Parameters:
      list1 - the primary word list
      list2 - one or more additional lists to combine with list1
      Returns:
      a list combining all of the provided lists

    • subtract

      public static Set<String> subtract​(Set<String> list1, Set<String>... list2)
      Returns a new word set that contains all of the words in list1 except for those in list2.
      Parameters:
      list1 - the primary word list
      list2 - one or more additional lists to subtract from list1
      Returns:
      a list of the remaining words after subtraction

    • intersect

      public static Set<String> intersect​(Set<String> list1, Set<String>... list2)
      Returns a new word set that contains only those words found in all of the given lists.
      Parameters:
      list1 - the primary word list
      list2 - one or more additional lists to combine with list1
      Returns:
      a list containing the intersection of all of the provided lists

    • removeDuplicates

      public static int removeDuplicates​(Set<String> words)
      If a word list contains a word in all lowercase, then any copies of the same word that use mixed case are superfluous since lowercase words will match any case pattern. This method removes these space-wasting duplicates from a list.
      Parameters:
      words - the list to optimize by removing duplicates
      Returns:
      the number of duplicates removed
